summary: In this context, uric acid is discussed in relation to its prognostic value in patients with interstitial lung disease (ILD) and its association with pulmonary hypertension (PH). Chronic hyperuricemia is noted as a risk factor for renal disease, indicating a significant relationship between elevated uric acid levels and kidney health. The text also contrasts acute increases in uric acid, which may have beneficial effects, with chronic conditions that pose risks to kidney function, highlighting the dual role of uric acid in health and disease.
